title: prince charles closest aide michael fawcett resigns cash honours
story: Prince Charles’s closest aide has stepped down from his role amid accusations that he helped to secure a knighthood for a donor to the Prince’s charity.Michael Fawcett, who has worked with Prince Charles for four decades, has left his position, Clarence House confirmed on Thursday night.Mr Fawcett began working for the Royal family in 1981, first as a junior footman to the Queen and then a personal valet to her eldest son. He rose through the ranks and in 2018 was made the chief executive of The Prince’s Foundation.Earlier this year, a letter from 2017 emerged in which Mr Fawcett allegedly told a Saudi billionaire who donated £1.5million to the Duke of Wales’s charity that he could help secure him an honour and citizenship.The letter allegedly written to Mahfouz Marei Mubarak bin Mahfou said: In light of the ongoing and most recent generosity of His Excellency Sheikh Mahfouz Marei Mubarak bin Mahfouz, I am happy to confirm to you, in confidence, that we are willing and happy to support and contribute to the application for citizenship.“I can further confirm we are willing to make an application to increase His Excellency’s honour from Honorary CBE to that of KBE in accordance with Her Majesty’s Honours Committee.Mr Mahfouz, 51, who is listed as a supporter on The Prince's Foundation website, donated large sums to restoration projects of particular interest to Prince Charles, specifically Dumfries House and the Castle of Mey in Scotland.In 2016, he was awarded an honorary CBE by the Prince at a private ceremony at Buckingham Palace.Sources close to the Prince have always strenuously denied that he was aware of any link between donations to his charity and honours.After the allegations emerged Mr Fawcett temporarily stepped down from his role pending a full investigation by the Prince’s Foundation. The charity regulator in Scotland launched its own investigation.A friend told the Daily Mail that accusations that he played a part in a “cash for honours” scandal had had a devastating effect.They told the paper: Michael has resigned and he will never be coming back. He has lost five stone in weight and is a shadow of his former self.A spokesman for The Prince’s Foundation said: “Michael Fawcett has resigned from his post as CEO of The Prince’s Foundation.”Clarence House confirmed it had severed its relationship with both Mr Fawcett and his events company.A Clarence House spokesman said: “Michael Fawcett and Premier Mode will not be providing services to us in future. We have all agreed to end these arrangements”More from NewsWar of the Worlds songwriter battles with sister over £3m inheritanceMedicines breakthrough could unlock Northern Ireland Protocol, says Maros SefcovicRory Cellan-Jones&#39s dog stolen along with five other pets as walker&#39s van was driven away by thieves&#39Freed Britney&#39: Singer could finally be released today from 13-year conservatorshipFrench prosecutors probe rape claims at President Emmanuel Macron&#39s palaceBritish troops helping Poland to fortify border with BelarusMore from The Back to topSyndication and CommissioningTerms and ConditionsWe urge you to turn off your ad blocker for The  website so that you can continue to access our quality content in the future.Visit our adblocking instructions

news cop-activists-deflate-tyres-luxury-"COP: Protesters gather on last day of summitByDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsClimate activists have deflated tyres on aposluxuryapos cars parked in Glasgow where COP has been taking place. Several SUVs in the cityaposs upmarket West End have been targeted - and been left flyers telling them go small. Go public transport. The group Tyred of SUVs has claimed responsibility for the spate of tyre deflating. Police Scotland said it was aware of the incidents and it had increased patrols in the area. Pharmacist Jamie MacConnacher ed to his Land Rover to discover the two front tyres had been deflated on Thursday morning.Mr MacConnacher wrote in a post on Facebook :Woke up to discover this whilst heading off to work!Do people not have better things to do with their le That’s one NHS worker delayed getting to work and patient care affected! A flyer left on Mr MacConnacheraposs vehicle said: ATTENTION. CLIMATE VIOLATION. Your SUV contributes to the carbon emissions rise in the last decade. This is why we have disarmed your car by deflating one or more of its tyres.Mr MacConnacher told BBC Radio Scotlandaposs Drivetime programme other cars in the area had also been targeted.He said: I donapost think targeting iniduals that have these vehicles is the right way to do it. They donapost know what the reason for somebody having that car is. Solicitor Lucy Conn, , found her tyres were let down as she was on her way to drive her three-year-old son to nursery along with her -month-old baby at around .pm yesterday.  She was told by a neighbour the tyres of several cars on the street had been deliberately hit. Ms Conn said: I thought it was a bit mean given there were two car seats in the back of the car - itaposs obviously not a car for one person. It is always normal folk that get the brunt of it. Tyred of SUVs said that no tyres were damaged in the action. A spokesperson for Tyred of SUVs said: If x drivers were a nation, theyaposd be the th biggest polluters on the planet . If the % wonapost take responsibility for the climate destruction they wreak, weaposll make them. A Police Scotland spokesperson said: We are aware of these incidents and there will be increased patrols in the area to provide reassurance to local residents. title: just two lgbt veterans who
story: Exclusive: Just two LGBT veterans who were kicked out of the military have got their medals backMinisters pledged in February to give justice to people thrown out of the Armed Forces due to their sexuality - but eight months later, there are few applications and even fewer successesSoldiers from Camberley and Sandhurst march in the  London Pride parade Image: Aldershot titlesByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsJust two LGBT veterans kicked out of the Armed Forces for their sexuality have got their medals back. Ministers pledged in February to “address the historic wrong” against brave gay personnel, who were not allowed to serve until a rule change in . Yet despite estimates  to  LGBT personnel were discharged every year, just six have applied to have their medals restored - and only two completed the process as of this week.That is despite the Sunday Mirror revealing some received a letter inviting them to claim medals back by Remembrance Sunday. Shadow Armed Forces Minister Stephen Morgan accused the government of falling short. He said: “Ministers must move much further and faster towards justice for those who were thrown out of our armed forces simply because of their sexuality.  “Warm words mean little to a community who have been treated so poorly despite their service to our country.” Caroline Paige, Joint Chief Executive Officer of Fighting with Pride, said: “The Government must raise its game and find an honourable future for those impacted by the ban”. Five veterans who were discharged for reasons related to their sexuality, and forfeited medals as a result, have applied up to November . One of those has had their medals restored. A further veteran who voluntarily surrendered their medals after being dismissed has got them back. The Ministry of Defence urged more veterans to come forward, eventhey have personal reasons for not having applied yet. MOD minister Leo Docherty said: “It is deeply regrettable that, because of their sexuality, some members of the Armed Forces were, in the past, treated in a way that would not be acceptable today.” An MOD spokesperson said: “We remain in contact with applicants and continue to encourage any LGBT veterans who may have been affected by this issue to submit an application for their case to be considered.” Comment MORE ON British ArmyMinistry of DefenceRemembrance DayArmed forcesPublic servicesSexuality" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news politics fresh-sleaze-claims-tories-take-"Sky News: Trevor Phillips says government in trouble over ‘sleaze’ByRachel WearmouthSenior Political Correspondent:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments The Tories face fresh sleaze allegations after it emerged MPs and the party have taken almost £.million in donations from the energy industry under Boris Johnson.The Prime Minister has been warned his climate crisis credentials lie in tatters as his party has been “swimming in oil and gas money” since he took power. An analysis of Electoral Commission records shows donations stretching back to  linking the party with oil and gas magnates.It comes as consumers are braced for massive hikes in their energy bills and as the PM attempts to lead efforts for the world to tackle climate change at the COP summit, while facing a flurry of sleaze claims levelled at his MPs since the resignation of Owen Paterson. Have your say on these donations in the comment section Anneliese Dodds, chairwoman of the Labour Party, told the Mirror: “Boris Johnson needs to show some leadership and put an end to the sleaze running rampant through his party and the cash-for-access culture at the heart of his Government.“Conservative MPs pocketing millions from vested interests can’t be acting in the national interest. It’s not a good look for the Prime Minister to claim commitment on moving past fossil fuels, but at the same time his own party is swimming in oil and gas money.“We need a Government that puts people and planet first, not one that thinks there’s one rule for the Conservative Party and another for everyone .”Donors to the Tories include Alexander Temerko, the Russian-born owner of Aquind. The energy boss and his company handed ious MPs, including former Cabinet ministers Liam Fox and Jeremy Hunt, and the current Chief Secretary to the Treasury Simon Clarke, and the party, more than £,.Aquind plans to build a £.billion energy pipeline under the English Channel and Mr Temerko was spotted sitting with COP President Alok Sharma at this year’s exclusive Black and White Ball, a fundraiser for the Conservative Party.Ian Taylor, the former chief executive of Vitol, who reportedly turned down a knighthood offered by former PM David Cameron, has also handed the party some £, since . The company he led until  is a major trader and supplier of North Sea crude oil. Weeks before the general election in , Mercantile  Maritime gave the party some £,. The commodities trading firm was founded by oil broker and billionaire Murtaza Lakhani. Matthew Ferrey, part of an elite group of Tory donors and a former executive with oil trader Vitol, has given the party £,. It includes £, to an inidual MP, the former minister and “ Brexit hardman” Steve Baker.The Wycombe MP told an event at Tory Party conference in  that while “the science is absolutely settled” on climate change, students should be taught they will get “poorer”, “colder”, and eat “insects for protein” as a result of climate policies.  Mr Baker declined to comment. The party’s former treasurer, Mick Davis, a South African-born former executive of mining company Xstrata also handed the party around £,.  In January, he set up a firm targeting “troubled mining assets” as well as joining the board of a “coal start-up”. A Tory source insisted the Conservatives were leading the climate change debate and alleged that claims to the contrary were “misguided”. He said: “No other party in government has done more than the Conservatives to reduce Britain’s dependency on dirty fossil fuels. “While Labour did next to nothing in government, we put net zero by  into law, banned the sale of new petrol and diesel cars by , and our Net Zero Strategy sets out a clear plan to decarbonise every part of our economy to eradicate the UK’s contribution to climate change. Any suggestion this Government is somehow not committed to tackling climate change is hilariously misguided.” The Mirror approached the MPs for comment about the donations, which were registered and are not subject to a standards investigation. Calls are intensying for a crackdown on MPs having second jobs after Sir Geoffrey Cox made some £m working as a barrister and adviser. Despite barely being in Parliament over the last year, Sir Geoffrey has said he will not stand down. Former Environment Secretary Owen Paterson was found to have repeatedly lobbied MPs and ministers on behalf of two companies, who together were paying him £,. title: geoffrey cox pockets 6m 10000
story: Geoffrey Cox pockets £m for , hours ​outside work - as Tories refuse to defend himIt came as Chancellor Rishi Sunak admitted we need to do better after presiding over a botched attempt to rip up standards rules - which has prompted a wave of headlines over sleazeTory MP Sir Geoffrey Cox Image: REUTERSByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsTop Tories have refused to defend two-jobs Geoffrey Cox as new analysis showed he has worked more than , hours outside Parliament. Tallies by theand the Daily Mail suggest the barrister made between £.m and £m from his private jobs since .Chancellor Rishi Sunak admitted the government “need to do better” after a failed bid to rip up the standards process for MPs last week. The revelations added fuel to criticism of Boris Johnson for presiding over the botched move - which sparked a wave of sleaze rows.They also add to criticism of the former Attorney General, elected in , over the huge extent of his outside work.Sir Geoffrey has spent  hours a week on private work in the last year, but only spoken in the Commons once in that time.And the QC missed Commons votes this week because he was on a business trip to Mauritius. Meanwhile he may face a standards probe over claims he joined a legal hearing from his Commons office. He denies wrongdoing. Senior ministers today refused to defend Sir Geoffrey - after Boris Johnson said MPs must put their job in Parliament first. Chancellor Rishi Sunak refused to comment on the specic case but admitted “we need to do better” on standards. Referring to Boris Johnson trying to tear up the system to save Owen Paterson over multiple breaches of lobbying rules, Mr Sunak said: “On the broader point - and just reflecting over recent events. “I think for us as a Government, itaposs fair to say that we need to do better than we did last week, and we know that. Business Minister Paul Scully also refused to offer any support to Sir Geoffrey. He told Sky News: “Iaposm not going to defend Geoffrey or say anything - thataposs up to Geoffrey, it is between him and his voters. Askedhe could see that the optics were not good in the second jobs debate, Mr Scully replied: Absolutely, I can see how it looks. It is really regrettable that weaposve got to this situation.  Pressed on what was regrettable about the situation, he added: That weaposve got in a position that, first of all, last week we allowed the situation for one inidualto be conflated with the standards procedures, which do need looking at, they do need an appeals process, but in order to do that we need a cross-party consensus. Then, as I say, for a number of other issues to be conflated which we need to tackle, but we need to tackle in a level-headed way and certainly not to get into a party political bun fight. One furious Tory backbencher told the Mirror: “I’m incredibly unimpressed and a lot of the  intake also are. “Would people want action  For sure. Because they work damn hard for their constituents and they don’t want to be tarred by these people who’ve been around for ever and seem to have a dferent set of standards and priorities.” Sir Geoffrey has said he does not believe he has breached parliamentary rules and will co-operate with any investigation. But he has claimed he had authorisation from the Tory Chief Whip to do work in the British Virgin Islands while Parliament was sitting.  In total he has taken part in hearings in the BVI’s corruption inquiry on  separate days this year when the Commons was sitting. Sir Geoffrey’s office issued a defiant statement saying he “regularly works -hour weeks” and constituency work is “given primary importance”. It went on: “Sir Geoffrey’s view is that it is up to the electors of Torridge and West Devon whether or not they vote for someone who is a senior and distinguished professional in his field and who still practices that profession. “That has been the consistent view of the local Conservative Association and although at every election his political opponents have sought to make a prominent issue of his professional practice, it has so far been the consistent view of the voters of Torridge and West Devon. “Sir Geoffrey is very content to abide by their decision.” But one unnamed constituent told PA: “I sent an email to Geoffrey Cox which I waited over  days for a response to. title: my mp earns much prime
story: My MP earns as much as the prime minister in just  DAYS of his second jobSome of Julian Smith MPs work on the side pays him £, an hour. So how exactly do his other jobs benefit the , people he represents in Parliament, asks Paul RoutledgeJulian Smith is the MP for Skipton and Ripon, the constituency where Paul Routledge lives Image: Barcroft Media via Getty ImagesopinionByPaul Routledge:,  Nov | commentsMy local MP, Julian Smith, is having a very profitable year. Literally. The Right Honourable Member for Skipton and Ripon earns almost as much as the Prime Minister – from his second jobs.He built up an impressive business portfolio after Boris Johnson sacked him as Northern Ireland Secretary.The House of Commons Register of Members’ Interests shows successful Smith has three places of work outside Westminster. He earns £, a year, plus VAT, as an external adviser on business development to Ryse Hydrogen of London, paid monthly, for  hours a year.Do you agree  Have your say in the comment section He also trousers £, a year, plus VAT, from MJM Marine of Newry in his old Ulster bailiwick, also paid monthly, for a more onerous - hours a year. From Simply Blue Management of Newquay, he picks up another £, per month plus VAT as an adviser, and is expected to put in - hours a month. This bumper pay packet totals £, a year for what could be less than eight days’ work, some of it at £, an hour. Yet his government baulks at a £ an hour National Minimum Wage, and tells workers on Universal Credit “work two more hours” to recoup their £ benefit cut. Of course, all this lovely moolah on top of his £, a year parliamentary salaryis approved by the authorities. It is perfectly legal and above board. All I can I say is: some authority, some law, some board. Smith must have business skills not readily apparent when he was a minister. As Theresa May’s chief whip, he broke the parliamentary rules on “pairing” and lost countless votes. He couldn’t whip a top. And he lasted less than seven months in Belfast. Quite what his second-jobbery does for the , people of his largely rural constituency escapes me. Frankly, I wouldn’t pay jammy Julian in washers, but he’s not alone in cashing in on the cachet of being an MP. Dozens of them are at it. There is pressure to end the privilege. Mirror readers are in no doubt, voting % to scrap the system.  The name above Julian Smith in the Register is Jeff Smith, Labour MP for Manchester Withington. He lists his outside interests as “Nil”. Further comment would be superfluous. ****** Requiring all NHS public-facing staff to get the jab is draconian, but perhaps necessary. But where’s the reciprocal sacrice by Covid patients  Most of those now in hospital are unvaccinated by their own choice. This is unbalanced and unfair. Acceptance of the jab by patients whose anti-vaxxery got them in there should also be compulsory. They’re largely to blame for spreading the virus to doctors, nurses and staff, not the other way round. ****** Footballer Marcus Rashford got an MBE for his magnicent campaign against child poverty, not the OBE.But he can take consolation that his award means ‘My Bloody Efforts’ whereas the higher gong means ‘Other Buggers’ Efforts’. title: stella creasy mp baby refused
story: Stella Creasy MP and her baby refused entry onto bus because of too many pushchairsLabour MP Stella Creasy was denied boarding on a London bus with her baby - despite a photo appearing to show the bus was fairly emptyLabour MP Stella Creasy holds her baby daughter in the House of Commons Image: PAByErtan Karpazli:,  Nov | commentsAn MP has hit out after saying she and her baby was not allowed on a bus - because two pushchairs were already on board. Labour MP for Walthamstow, Stella Creasy, attempted to board a London bus with her baby on Tuesday, but was refused boarding by the driver. Ms Creasy posted a photo on Twitter showing the inside of the bus she was attempting to board.While two pushchairs can be seen in the space allocated to pushchairs and wheelchairs on the bus, the rest of the bus appears half empty, with plenty of space for another pushchair.Based on the photo MP Creasy posted, MyLondon was able to geolocate where the alleged incident took place in Chingford Mount, north east London. Tagging London’s Deputy Mayor of London for Transport, Heidi Alexander, as well as London Mayor Sadiq Khan, Ms Creasy said: “Well that wasn’t fun. “Just been kicked off an empty bus by a bus driver because there were two pushchairs already on it. “Surely when the bus is this empty andlarge amount of space as you can see it can’t be TfL policy to do this !” Her tweet triggered a wave of supportive comments from mothers who have also encountered the same problem. “I had the same problem  years ago. I had hoped that times might have moved on,” said one. Another said: “Same thing happened to me  years ago. Ridiculous rules. Passengers with babies kids in pushchairs should be prioritised alongside iniduals in wheelchairs and buses should be remodelled to be able to take more of these passengers”. One user also commented saying London Mayor Sadiq Khan “might remind drivers that it is illegal to stop or refuse to allow the transit or transport” of an MP who might be on route to Parliament. Former Liberal Democrat councillor Stephen Fenwick weighed in saying: “Surely you couldaposve used the old ‘do you know who I am ’ trick to get on board   I used it many times a few years ago when I was a cllr and got my way.” But MP Creasy replied, saying: “Would oddly enough never do that but struggling with two children, one extremely poorly, and being shouted at for just getting on a bus is not great. Also it seems bizarrea bus is not full to demand someone get off - that’s why I want to knowit’s TfL policy !” Guidelines on using pushchairson Transport for London buses can be found on the TfL website. “Drivers should make sure passengers have time to position their buggy safely, and hold on or sit down before moving away,” the TfL website says, asking passengers to “fold the buggy upitaposs too wide to fit through the doors and down the aisle”. The website says: “If youaposre using a double buggy, feel free to get on the bus at the back exit doors, but remember to check with the driver first. “For safety reasons and general passenger comfort, move your buggy out of the middle aisle. “All buses have a wheelchair space available. By law, wheelchair users have priority over the space as it is the only place they can travel safely. When a wheelchair user is not using the space, you can use it on a first come first served basis. “If a wheelchair user wishes to board a bus, you should share the space, fold your buggy or move. You will not be asked to leave the bus, but you may choose to do so. “If you wish to board the next bus instead, the driver will issue you a transfer ticket so you donapost need to pay a double fare”. title: tory mp denies faking constituency
story: Tory MP denies faking constituency visits after posting same selfie three timesDon Valley MP Nick Fletcher uploaded identical pictures of himself posing in the market town of ThorneTory MP Nick Fletcher posted an identical picture on his Facebook page three timesByRachel WearmouthSenior Political Correspondent:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments A Tory MP denies faking visits to a town in his constituency despite posting an identical photo on his Facebook page three times.Nick Fletcher, who represents South Yorkshireaposs Don Valley, uploaded an image of himself posing on a high street in the market town of Thorne, supposedly on  November. “Great to spend the afternoon in Thorne. It is good to see it thriving again after a tough year,” the post read. But eagle-eyed residents spotted a Christmas tree in the background, and pointed out the townaposs festive decorations had not been put up yet. It later transpired that the same image was uploaded by the MP on two other occasions, on  December last year and  September this year, when the MP participated in several parliamentary votes.  The -year-old has insisted he was in fact in Thorne, near Doncaster, on November  – but says he forgot to take a photo before leaving. The MP has since claimed he forgot to take a photo during his trip and says it is not the first time he has re-used pictures when visiting parts of his constituency. He said: Having spent the afternoon walking round Thorne with a local business man and calling at a local café for a coffee, I forgot to take a photo. This is not the first time I have reused a photo when forgetting to take one and I am sure it will not be the last. Following anger from constituents at the apparently fake November  post, he updated it, writing: Apologies, forgot to take a photo on my walk about. Will make sure I take one when I’m back again next week. Look forward to seeing you all soon. He also tweeted: It has been widely reported that yesterday, I reused an old photo of me visiting Thorne. While I did in fact attend a surgery there, it was a mistake for me to reuse a picture. So, on my next visit, I’ll make sure to take a new photo to promote this great town in #DonValley! news politics tory-mp-who-said-marcus-"Tory MPs WhatsApp message criticising Rashford leakedByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA Tory MP who suggested Marcus Rashford should stick to the day job has a second job. Natalie Elphicke earns around £ an hour in her work outside Parliament as the chair of the New Homes Quality Board. She was handed a one-off £, in November , and since January has been paid just under £ per week for eight hours’ work, on top of her £k job as an MP. The organisation exists to “promote a new code for housebuilding standards” and Ms Elphicke has spent around  hours on the job since she was appointed in May . Ms Elphicke is one of scores of MPs with work outside Parliament, a practice ministers insist brings a “richness” to Parliamentary experience. But she is now in the spotlight because of comments she made about Marcus Rashford, for which she apologised in July.  England suffered heartbreak in the Euro  final after a - penalty shootout loss handed victory to Italy. And Ms Elphicke hit headlines after questioning Rashfordaposs commitment to the game when he missed a penalty. She wrote to Tory MPs: Would it be ungenerous to say Rashford should have spent more time perfecting his game and less time playing politics. Rashford, who was awarded an MBE for his campaigning for vulnerable children, forced the Government into embarrassing U-turns on free school meals and has raised more than £m for charity. Labour Deputy Leader Angela Rayner blasted Ms Elphicke for sneering at the inspirational player at the time. Tory MP Simon Hoare said: Would it be ungenerous  Yes. Unwarranted  Yes. Wrong  Yes. Downing Street also slapped down the MP, saying she had rightly apologised. Ms Elphicke said at the time: I regret messaging privately a rash reaction about Marcus Rashfordaposs missed penalty and apologise to him for any suggestion that he is not fully focussed on his football. Ms Rayner said last night: “Marcus Rashford is the pride of Manchester and he doesn’t need the permission of anyone to do the wonderful work that he does.“ Boris Johnson needs to decide whether his MPs are MPs representing their constituents orthey are advisers and consultants working for private interests who pay them. They can’t be both.“It’s time for the Prime Minister to come out of hiding. His refusal to take action sends a clear message that he is happy with the status quo.” Comment MORE ON Conservative PartyMarcus RashfordBoris JohnsonEuro The EuroPolitics" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get UK politics insight with our free daily email briefing straight to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: beefeater asked consider selling tower
story: Beefeater asked to consider selling Tower of London by estate agents in baffling letterThe Tower of London has remained in control of the Crown for nearly all of its , year history - but Foxtons estate agents have asked a Beefeater to consider selling the prime propertyYeoman Warder Spike Abbott, , has spent the past  years living in a two-bed flat in the Tower of London Image: TwitterByKate BuckNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA Beefeater who lives inside the Tower of London has been asked by an estate agentshe would consider selling his famous home. Yeoman Warder Spike Abbott, , couldnapost believe it when Foxtons sent him a letter saying it was valuing property in the area, and wonderedhe would be interested in one of their agents coming round. Mr Abbott, who lives in the lands of the iconic London landmark with  other Yeoman Warders and their families, said it would likely raise a few eyebrowsa For Sale sign appeared outside his two-bed flat. He tweeted: “Thanks for the very kind offer Foxtons to sell or rent out the th century property that HM Tower of London provide me with, however, I think it may raise a few eyebrows when your sign appears outside my house.  The letter - believed to be from the Wapping branch of the agents - said we are valuing property in your area next week before offering to give a no strings attached professional opinion of the sales or rental value of your property in the current market. The Beefeaters are the oldest military corp and existing military corp royal bodyguards in the country. They consist of ex-military members who have served at least  years and hold the Long Service and Good Conduct medal.  Onetheir main jobs in modern times is to show tourists around the -acres which encompass the site, but they are still tasked with protecting it from intruders. Mr Abbott served for  years in the RAF, before joining the Tower six year ago. When he first moved into the property in , he said: “I’m living in a two-bedroom flat in a converted hospital block with all the other Beefeaters. It’s got a village feel. We even have our own pub, the Yeoman’s Club.” In terms of valuations, it is unclearthe bloody history of the Tower would affect the pricing of the listing. It is where two young princes are said to have been murdered and buried under a stair case.  In , Princes Edward and Richard, aged  and , were sent to the Tower for their own protection by their uncle the Duke of Gloucester - who later become King Richard III. But they were never seen again, sparking rumours they had been smothered in their beds and in  the skeletons of two young boys matching the ages of the lost princes were found under a staircase in the White Tower. And the courtyard of the Tower served as the stage where Anne Boleyn was beheaded at the request of her husband King Henry VIII. The Tower and its grounds are said to be haunted by the ghost of the former Queen, whose headless ghost has been spotted leading a procession of knights of ladies towards the scene of her death. Guy Fawkes was famously tortured to death at the Tower, and his screams are said to be heard through the walls - which could draw some complaints from any new neighbours. The Mirror has contacted Foxtons for comment. title: boy 5 diagnosed rare childhood
story: Boy, , diagnosed with rare childhood dementia after losing ability to walkIsaac Tilley was diagnosed with CLN Batten Disease in August. The condition is also known as childhood dementia and causes kids to have a shortened le expectancyIsaac Tilley in hospital Image: Caters NewsByCally BrooksChiara Fiorillo:,  Nov | commentsA five-year-old boy has been diagnosed with rare childhood dementia, with his devastated family now raising awareness of the condition. Little Isaac Tilley suffered from a range of symptoms including seizures, loss of mobility, and delayed speech for two years. His mum Aimee Tilley, , was devastated when he was diagnosed with CLN Batten disease in August. The rare condition is also known as childhood dementia and causes kids to have a shortened le expectancy. Isaacaposs mum, his dad Adrian, , and sister Eva, eight, have been warned he may not reach his teenage years, even though his treatment is designed to slow down the progression of the disease. Isaac lost the ability to play football, run and even walk in just eight months, his mum said.  Aimee, who is now Isaacaposs full-time carer, said: When he was three, he had his first seizure and  days later after another seizure, he was diagnosed with epilepsy. He was also suffering from speech delay and at one point, I thought he may have autism. His private speech therapist had noticed something wasnapost right which encouraged me to ask for Isaac to be referred to a neurologist in Oxford. It wasnapost until January this year that I noticed his hands and legs would shake and he was unsteady on his feet, this got worse over the next few months and his speech still wasnapost coming along either. He had an MRI, heart tests, blood tests, and a lumbar puncture in February but it wasnapost until August, after receiving results from an Epilepsy Panel test, taken the previous November at our local hospital, that we were given the devastating diagnosis of CLN Batten disease.  The mum added: We had never heard of Batten disease and were given an out-of-date leaflet and told he wouldnapost make it to see his teenage years. Itaposs classed as a form of childhood dementia as children progressively lose all their skills and eventually die. Isaac has lost the ability to run, play football, ride his bike and scooter, and even walk without support in just eight months. Itaposs heartbreaking to watch. In his head he still wants to do these things but physically he canapost. Before this, Isaac was so athletic so the only warning sign we had was his delayed speech in the beginning but that can be put down to a lot of other things. I was told, boys are lazy, heaposll catch up, which was so frustrating. I want more parents to know about Batten Disease and to be aware of early symptoms becauseit had been diagnosed sooner, Isaac would be having a much greater quality of le than he does currently. The sooner children start treatment, the better. According to the Batten Disease Family Association, only four children are diagnosed with the juvenile form of Batten disease every year, making it rare and dficult to treat.  Aimee added: Iaposm so desperate to raise awareness because there isnapost enough known about it and Iaposve found myself explaining to doctors and other health professionals what Batten disease is. Everyone needs to be aware of this vile disease, it may be rare but it can affect anyone. When he was having seizures, he didnapost fit into a particular group for epilepsy which should have been our first warning sign but this wasnapost investigated. Isaac is currently on enzyme replacement therapy, given via brain infusions every two weeks at Great Ormond Street, which is currently funded by NHSE but in , it could be taken away as itaposs costing £, per child per year. I understand itaposs expensive but it works and children are thriving on it! We are still so early into treatment that we are still seeing Isaac decline but I believe like the other children he will gain back some of his lost skills. We were told to expect decline for up to  months and then he should plateau for a while.  His speech has declined even more, he drools now, he still has seizures now and then, he canapost stand still, heaposs lost a lot of core strength, he doesnapost like to walk unsupported because heaposs lost his confidence since falling so much and his mobility is continually declining. No mother should have to watch their child go through this. Eventually without treatment, they would expect Isaac to go blind and his body will shut down. Batten disease is an inherited condition, only passed downboth parents have the gene. Thankfully, Isaacaposs sister Eva does not have the condition. The family have no idea how long they have with Isaac and are trying to make as many memories as possible. Aimee said: The treatment isnapost a cure, itaposll slow down the progression but we donapost know how long for. I want people to know the signs and encourage parents to push for answerssomething doesnapost seem right. We recently went to Thomas Land and are going to Lapland UK in December. Iaposm desperate to make as many fun memories for us all while we can. Especially whilst Isaac still has his sight. Making memories together is the most important thing to me now and we have to put a brave face on every day. I live in hope every day a cure will be found to save Isaac and all the other little warriors like him. I just want to raise awareness for this condition and encourage other parents to look into it and do their research. I live with regret every day I didnapost do more. The family is currently fundraising for adaptations needed for their home, equipment and making memories with Isaac.To donate, click here.Comment MORE ON Great Ormond Street HospitalHospitalsLe expectancyMental healthTherapyDementiaEpilepsyAsperger’s syndromeChildrens Hospital" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: dad shocked after finding venomous
story: Dad shocked after finding venomous spider eggs in Morrisons bag of bananasRafal Murawski, , bought the fruit from Morrisons at the Peel Centre in Bracknell and was shocked to find a nest on the outside. He said his son couldnt sleep due to his fear of the spidersRafal said his young son couldnt even sleep because of the idea that deadly spiders were in the house Image: Berkshire Live   Darren PepeByLeigh Mcmanus:,  Nov | commentsAn arachnophobic was left horried after finding a nest of potentially deadly spiders on a bunch of bananas he bought from his local Morrisons. Rafal Murawski, , bought the fruit from the branch at the Peel Centre in Bracknell, Berkshire on the morning of Thursday, October , and was shocked to find a nest on the outside. Rafal said his young son couldnapost even sleep because of the idea of the spiders being in the house, adding that he was appalled by the reaction of the staff in Morrisons when he brought the bananas back. Thankfully, none of the spider eggs hatched, but Rafal fears they were likely to the worldaposs deadliest arachnid - the Brazilian wandering spider. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here However, Morrisons has said it is unlikely the eggs are from the deadly spider, as the bananas are from Ecuador, where there are not as many venomous species. Mr Murawski said: It was shocking really. I bought the bananas and saw there was this horrible spideraposs nest on there. I hate spiders, so I was quite worried. I knew the bananas had come from Ecuador, so I did some research and read a few articles. I think itaposs very likely these are the eggs of a Brazilian wandering spider. They can be very venomous so obviously it was a worry for me. Mr Murawski, who describes himself as an arachnophobic, said his seven-year-old son has not been able to sleep since they found the nest. And the dad was left surprised by the reaction of staff when he ed the bananas, as he claims the store manager just laughed when I told her. She even offered me another bunch from the same batch, he said.  I was very surprised. Iaposve read in other places stores were closed because of discoveries like these, but there didnapost seem to be any process here at all. A Morrisons spokesperson said: Weaposre sorry that the customer was worried, but we can confirm our bananas are not sourced from Brazil. She said the company works with selected farms in South America to ensure high-quality agricultural practices are maintained. There are five checkpoints for quality before the bananas make it to the supermarket, including checks for insects and spiders before the fruit is packed.  There are also several inspections when they arrive in the UK. The Brazilian wandering spider gets its name from roaming around the jungle floor in South America at night, looking for prey. The Guinness Book of Records says itaposs the most toxic spider in the world, but there have been few deaths from its bite. It only injects venom in a third of its bites and statistics showed out of , cases, just  people died. However, it can still be extremely painful, and cause an unwanted erection in men which lasts for four hours. news uk-news driver-last-bus-strands-crying-"Driver refuses to let teen on the last bus homeByHannah LucasMilo BoydNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA young girl was left in floods of tears in the road after a bus driver refused to let her on board. The -year-old had just missed hopping aboard the last service from Beverley Bus Station to Dunswell in East Yorkshire.She pleaded with the bus driver to let her on the vehicle so she could get home, but he refused, Hull Daily Mail reported. Fortunately a police officer witnessed the encounter and came over to see what was going on. The girlaposs dad, Gary Hockney, said: She was so upset. It happened on Sunday night and on Monday she didnapost go to college. She was frightened to go on the bus because she goes on a public bus and she was worried that she would bump into this driver.  She came back on Monday and she was in tears about it and explained that was why. The teenager tried to board the East Yorkshire Bus service at .pm on Sunday, November , after visiting her friends. She claims that as she reached the bus it began to pull away. The girl stood in front of the bus while it was still in the parking bay so she was visible to the driver. But, she claims he refused to let her on and instead continually beeped the horn, flashed his lights and revved the engine while she was in tears. Can you just open the door, I need to get home, she can be heard saying in a video.  A police officer believed to have been dealing with another incident at the station came over after witnessing the incident unfold and spoke with the bus driver, who said that he could not open the doors due to health and safety reasons. Speaking about the incident, Mr Hockney said: In her words, which isnapost wrong going by the footage, the bus was still in the parking bay and as she approached it, it began to pull away. She was directly in front of the doors and in full view of the driver. He looked at her, he saw her and carried on pulling out. She started crying at one point and heaposs revving his engine, flashing his lights, beeping his horn and then fortunately a police officer in the station at the time came over and asked what was going on. If you look at the footage, she challenged the driver and he just referred to this blunt health and safety policy.  Fortunately for the girl, the police officer gave her a lt back home. Mr Hockney said: I want to draw attention to his actions but also the officers, because itaposs such a positive thing that she did, I would have picked her up but it was such a nice gesture. Having thought about it might be that the bus company doesnapost allow that sort of discretion, which is stupid. They should give their employees the confidence to make those decisions. Iaposm sure he would have let his own daughter on in that situation orhe saw somebody being chased or something surely at some point thereaposs a cut off and you show some discretion. A spokesperson for East Yorkshire Buses said: On Sunday night one of our buses was in the process of leaving Beverley Bus Station at its scheduled departure time when a late arriving passenger ran out in front of it to try to stop it leaving. For safety reasons, our drivers are advised not to allow any more passengers to board once they have closed the doors and reversed off the bus station stands, as it is unsafe for passengers to try to enter the part of the station where buses are moving. The passenger refused to move from in front of the bus, so a police officer who was in the station dealing with some antisocial behaviour came to speak to the driver, and agreed to give the passenger a lt home so that the bus could continue on its way. Our driver was satisfied that the passenger was safe, and the bus was able to continue with its journey.We’d advise that passengers always ensure they arrive at their bus stop in good time, and we have live tracking features on our website and app which you can use to ensure you never miss a bus.” Comment MORE ON Teenagers" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: five athletes who refused royal
story: Five athletes who refused royal honours - and why they turned down the titlesHonours from the royals are often deemed the pinnacle of inidual success, but not everybody thinks so and the long list of those who have turned down honours includes sports starsWorld cup winner Richie McCaw supposedly turned down a knighthood Image: Corbis via Getty ImagesByBenjamin LynchSEO writerChris Byfield:,  Nov | comments Athletes Dame Kelly Holmes, Sir Andy Murray, Sir Lewis Hamilton and Dame Jessica Ennis-Hill all have one thing in common theyaposve each been honoured by the royals.Marcus Rashford is one of the most recent sports stars to accept the honour, this time for services to vulnerable children. The Manchester United playeraposs campaign encouraged the government to u-turn on its free school meals vouchers over lockdown and earned him an MBE. But the titles bestowed upon people by the royals are not always so welcome, many athletes oppose the UK having a Royal family and some feel uncomfortable with the troubled history of the British Empire.Five athletes who have refused royal honours Howard Gayle Howard Gayle was the first black football player to represent Liverpool and was part of the squad when the reds won the European Cup against Real Madrid in .Gayle later went on to Birmingham City, Sunderland and Stoke before playing for Blackburn. After his career he went on to work for the campaign aposShow Racism the Red Cardapos, for which the Royals intended to reward him. He said: I had to decline the nomination for the reason that my ancestors would be turning in their graves after how Empire and Colonialism had enslaved them. It would be a betrayal to all the Africans who have lost their lives, or who suffered as a result of Empire. Richie McCaw New Zealand rugby player Richie McCaw is one of the All Blacksapos greatest ever players. He was central to some of the best teams in rugby history and one that won two world cup titles in  and  respectively.Out of his  tests, he was captain for  of them and retired at the end of the  campaign. No knighthood was ever formally offered, but in  New Zealandaposs then Prime Minister John Key said he had spoken to McCaw about the possibility of a knighthood, but the player had declined. McCaw is believed to have had his doubts over being a aposSirapos during his playing career. Peter Alliss  aposThe Voice of Golfapos Peter Alliss turned down an OBE in .The golf hall of fame persoanlity was a good player in his own right. He won  professional tournaments including three British PGA Championships in ,  and . He also had five top- finishes in The Open.After his career, Alliss became a beloved broadcaster and commentator within the game, but was known for being outspoken and would often draw criticism. He said: But, as a commentator, I still get hurt by the criticism. I might get a hundred letters and  of them are very nice but I remember the five that call me a p****. Theyaposre usually badly spelt and scrawled on yellow paper and I wonder why they feel the need to write so vehemently. Bill Woodfull Bill Woodfull captained the Australian cricket team and gained notoriety in particular through what became known as the aposbodylineapos series.This involved Englandaposs bowlers aiming at the head or torso of the Australian batsman. Woodfull opposed the tactic and deemed it against the spirit of the game. He was offered a knighthood for his services to cricket in , but turned it down. Woodfull said he would have acceptedit was for his services to education, as he was a teacher. He eventually received an OBE for services to education . Maharajkumar of Vizianagram  Maharajkumar of Vizianagram was not known for his cricketing abiities, but managed to secure the captaincy of the Indian team upon their tour to England in . The tour was disastrous and India were beaten easily. The captaincy of aposVizzyapos, whose real name was Lt. Col. Pusapati Vijay Ananda Gajapathi Raju, portioned a large part of the blame and he was criticised for being aposestablishmentapos. Vizzy was knighted during the tour and remains the only Test cricketer to be knighted during his playing days. He renounced his knighthood in  when India gained its independence from the British EmpireMost ReadDont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Howard GayleRichie McCawKelly HolmesMarcus RashfordJessica EnnisJohn KeyLewis HamiltonAndy MurrayRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: gen z most likely plan
story: Gen-Z more likely to plan their funerals than any other age groupDistinct Cremations have quizzed the public and found that  to -year-olds may have a plan in place alreadyStats show that Gen-Zs have thought way more about their funerals than others Image: GettyByEmily Sleight:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsFunerals are never a subject we want to discuss or think about, but they are inevitable. Many of us try to be organised and establish a plan, others can’t even bear to think about the costs. Funeral specialists, Distinct Cremations, has quizzed Brits to find out their thoughts and opinions on death and burials. It found that  per cent of us don’t have a funeral plan in place yet, with the most popular funeral type being an ‘upbeat celebration of le.’ Perhaps the most staggering statistic is the fact that Gen-Z may be more funeral prepared as opposed to the older generation. The figures show that those aged  to  are the ones who are most likely to have a plan in place for their funeral. . per cent of --year-olds say they have a plan, which is almost double the amount of people within the age bracket of - at . per cent. In fact, those between the ages  and  were the least likely to have considered funeral arrangements. Ages + were less likely to plan their own funerals at . per cent, as opposed to  to  year olds at over  per cent. The figures also showed that less than half of us have savings for emergencies, and would not be able to pay for the funeral of a loved one.  per cent of those who said they couldn’t afford to pay for the funeral of a loved one would need to resort to borrowing the money either from a friend or family member or by taking out a loan.  Some even suggested resorting to a crowdfunding site, with  per cent believing this would be the only option. Others considered selling items to raise money. Steve Wallis, managing director of Distinct Cremations, said: “It’s staggering to think that so many do not have savings in place for an emergency. “The death of a loved one is hard enough, without financial pressure adding to the grief. The fact that so many believe it is their responsibility, yet four in ten said they have no savings in place for such emergencies, really highlights the disparity between the present and future.” Figures show that  per cent of us would have to get an emergency payday loan to pay for the funeral, while  per cent believe the deceased person’s estate would cover the cost. But why is Gen-Z so prepared  Well, it could be because over a third of UK adults said that the Covid- pandemic has made them think dferently about funerals. –-year-olds are the most likely to have had their perceptions of funerals changed as a result of the pandemic and over a fthof those aged + also agreed. Wallis concluded: “There’s no doubt that the last  months brought funerals to the forefront of our minds, with many of us unable to have the big funerals that were planned, or indeed faced with planning a funeral out of the blue. “As such, no longer are many people wanting to follow traditions and have big funerals with services afterwards. Instead, people are realising they can have a simple funeral for a fraction of the cost, minimising the impact this has on their friends and family.” For funeral notices in your area visit funeral-notices Comment MORE ON FuneralsFrisk" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: having covid jab losing your
story: Having the Covid jab or losing your NHS job is sadly the only way to goEnforced vaccination makes me feel uncomfortable, but frontline medical staff have a duty of care for their patients, says Eva SimpsonMore effort is needed to prove to people the Covid- vaccine is safe Image: SOPA Images LightRocket via Getty ImagesopinionByEva Simpson:,  Nov | comments It’s a shame it had to come to this. Yesterday the Government confirmed it will be mandatory for frontline NHS workers to have the Covid vaccine.With the exception of those with a medical reason not to, everyone must have had two jabs, most likely by April. Reluctantly I think it is the right call. No one should be made to do anything they don’t want to do. Butpeople don’t want the vaccination then they shouldn’t be in jobs that involve looking after some of the sickest and most vulnerable people in our society. Mandatory jabs are nothing new. Healthcare staff doing certain procedures need to have had the hepatitis B vaccine.Do you agree  Have your say in the comment section Some argue that’s dferent as people who went into the profession knew they had to have the jab beforehand, so were able to make their own choices, while this is something retrospective. But we are where we are. It’s nothing short of a miracle that we have vaccines to protect us from a virus that has already claimed the lives of , people in Britain alone. I believe in the Covid vaccines. I’m double jabbed. I certainly wouldn’t ask someone to do something I wouldn’t be prepared to do myself.  But I also have an  year old grandmother with a lung condition – she needs a machine at night to help with her breathing. Would I be happy for an unvaccinated health worker to look after her  From a totally selfish point of view I wouldn’t. I want the safest pairs of hands possible giving her care. The NHS, scientists and our political leaders need to do a much better job of explaining that the vaccines are safe and have been tested on people across the world. I feel desperately sorry for anyone who feels they will have to leave the profession over this – there are already , unfilled positions in the NHS in England. They certainly shouldn’t be hounded out of the profession. Maybe they can be found jobs where they don’t come into contact with vulnerable people. I hope before April’s deadline more workers are convinced about the efficacy of the vaccines and roll up their sleeves to have the jab. It would be a shame to lose dedicated workers when we need them more than ever. news uk-news man-caught-camera-rolling-up-"Rochdale: Thief steals articial grass from front gardenByPaul Byrne:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA family is hoping someone will grass after a brazen thief stole their new articial front lawn. The suspect was caught on camera passing the Hendersons’ front garden with a drink can in his hand. Seconds later the plastic turf was rolled up and taken away. Daughter Courtney, , said: “My mum opened the curtains and was like: ‘Where’s the grass gone ’ “She was really confused at first and rang my dad askinghe knew why someone had taken the grass.” She added: “It’s really bizarre because it’s like the smallest piece of grass ever.” A neighbour’s CCTV captured the moment the turf was lted at pm on Sunday as the family sat in their lounge in Heywood, Gtr Manchester, last Sunday. Courtney said: “It was at around pm, like an hour after my dad got in. I was literally on the couch at the time. “I don’t think it could be someone trying to sell it for money because it’s the tiniest thing ever, it must only be worth around £ at the most.”  The beauty business owner said the thief had a distinct walk and was wearing a bucket hat. She added: “I just don’t get how no one has seen a man walking down the street with a roll of grass. “He’s got a distinct walk and he’s wearing a bucket hat. Surely someone knows this guy as there can’t be that many people walking around Heywood with a can and a bucket hat.” Comment MORE ON CCTVCCTV footageCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man utd star marcus rashford
story: Man Utd star Marcus Rashford slams school refusing meals to pupils in debtParents of pupils at Ysgol Dyffryn Nantlle in Penygroes, Gwynedd, were told their children would not be fed " they are more than a penny in debt"Marcus Rashford made the remarks on social media Image: PAByMari JonesWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsEngland footballer Marcus Rashford has called for compassion after a Welsh secondary school head teacher announced meals would not be served to children who owed money for food.Parents of pupils at Ysgol Dyffryn Nantlle in Penygroes, Gwynedd, were told their children would not be fedthey are more than a penny in debt, Wales Online reports. The Manchester United star, whose campaigning work on securing free school meals for children saw him handed an MBE, tweeted: Has the pandemic not taught us anything  Can we not be understanding  Come on now…He added: For many children, lunch at school is the only meal they’ll get…  In a letter to parents Neil Foden, the strategic head of Ysgol Dyffryn Nantlle, said the school cook had been instructed not to give food to any childtheir debt has not been cleared, or, in the future, to children whose accounts do not have enough money to pay for lunch. A deadline of November  has been set for parents to get their childrenaposs accounts up to date as there was a a deficit in the school meals budget at the end of the last half term. Mr Foden said a handful of pupils had run up debts totalling close to £, and apologised for the approach but said the scale of the default means that something clearly has to be done. He said: All debts over £ will be transferred to the authority and parents will be invoiced by the council. All debts of over £. will receive a message from the school to clear debts and credit the system by Friday, November th.The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  The original message sparked fury on social media with some criticising the headteacheraposs decision. One person wrote: Absolutely shocking. What the hell’s wrong with system, the child might not know mam and dad are struggling to pay, it might be the only food that child eats that day. Another said: If they would actually let you pay your £. bill Without having to pay a min payment of £, would be a help. Seriously! One more person said: I would suggest that the head himself tells the kids they cant eat, donapost put that on the kitchen staff! Weaposve gone from giving children free breakfasts to this. Think of the damage this is doing! A Gwynedd Council spokesperson said previously: “We would urge any parent orwho are having dficulty in paying for their child’s school meals to contact the education department or school directly. Their child may be entitled to free school meals. “In terms of payment of school meals, an online system has been introduced on which parents should ensure that sufficient funds are in place to pay for their child’s school meals. The payment system offers some flexibility for parents who may for whatever reason not be able to make payment for a short period of time. Reminder messages are sent as required to ensure that no signicant debts are incurred. “As a council, we do not operate a blanket policy of refusing meals to pupils, and will discuss this matter directly with the school.” Comment MORE ON Marcus RashfordSecondary schoolDebt" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news meghan-markle-aide-broke-ranks-"Thomas Markle glad the truth is coming out about MeghanByLorraine KingNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov Meghan Markleaposs former aide dramatically broke ranks to reveal her texts and emails weeks after her controversial interview with Oprah was aired, it is claimed. Jason Knauf is said to have repeatedly refused to help the Mail on Sunday in its bitter legal battle with the Duchess of Sussex saying he wanted to stay “neutral”.But court papers allege the -year-old performed a dramatic U-turn in the aftermath of three major royal crises, The Sun reports.The first was in February when Meghan won her High Court case against the publication over a leaked letter she sent to her -year-old estranged dad Thomas.  Meghan penned the emotional letter in  and parts of it were then reproduced in the Mail on Sunday the next year. The -year-old claimed it misused her private information, infringed herand breached the Data Protection Act and won the case. In March, Buckingham Palace said it had launched an official investigation following a complaint by Mr Knauf that Meghan had bullied three members of household staff.The announcement came just days before the bombshell two-hour interview with Meghan , Harry and the US chat show queen Oprah Winfrey was aired.The couple made a number of explosive royal claims including alleging that a senior royal asked how “dark” Harry and Meghan’s son Archie would be when he was born.Meghan, an ex-actress, also claimed that royal le had left her on the verge of suicide.  At the time of the interview being aired Mr Knaufwas being represented by lawyers acting for three other royal aides dubbed the “Palace Four”.On April , they said Mr Knauf still wished to stay “strictly neutral” despite repeated approaches from the Mail on Sundayaposs parent company, Associated Newspapers. A month later Mr Knauf announced he was stepping down as Meghanaposs communication secretary before a “confidential source” approached the Mail on Sunday to tell them he had undergone a dramatic change of heart. During the third and final day of the hearing on Thursday, further documents were released which revealed that a confidential source contacted the publisher with the information that Mr Knauf, who is due to stand down from his current role as the chief executive officerof the Royal Foundation at the end of the year, regretted not giving evidence during the High Court proceedings. In a witness statement, Keith Mathieson, solicitor for ANL, said he believed Mr Knauf’s evidence was “honest and credible”.  Mr Mathieson said that, in April, Mr Knauf’s then legal team contacted ANL’s lawyers to say he did not wish to have any involvement in the proceedings and that his position was “strictly neutral”. However, following the judgment in Meghan’s favour, ANL was contacted by the source in July and approached Mr Knauf, who by then wished to provide a statement for the appeal. He added: “Mr Knauf was plainly a central figure in the events he describes. “He was a senior and trusted member of the royal household staff and he continues to occupy an important position as CEO of The Royal Foundation. “His witness statement is measured in tone and he has been careful not to include evidence of matters beyond his own personal knowledge. “Given the high profile nature of this litigation and the likelihood of his evidencebeing widely reported, as well as the position he holds, it is hardly conceivable that he would say anything he did not believe to be true and I know of nothing in his evidence which is subject to any reasonable challenge. Mr Knauf was communications secretary to the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and Prince Harry from February  to May . After Harry and Meghan’s wedding he became communications secretary to both couples until March . Later that year he became CEO of the Cambridges’ Royal Foundation charity, a position he will step down from next month. news uk-news meghan-markles-k-good-vibes-"Meghan Markle being very clever with brand says hostByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsMeghan Markle often pairs her outfits with intricate pieces of jewellery that have hidden meanings. And during her appearance at a virtual summit earlier this week, it appears that she wore a stunning diamond bracelet thataposs meant to attract good vibes only.On Tuesday, Meghan spoke at the New York Times DealBook conference, where she wore a sleek all-black outfit.She paired it with an aposEye of Protectionapos bracelet, reports Page Six, which is by jewellery brand Mateo and comes in around £,.According to the Mateo website, the piece is made from -carat gold and is hand-painted with enamel by skilled artisans.  And the brand adds: Ward off undesired energy with this bracelet and attract good vibes only. However, itaposs not the first time Meghan has worn jewellery meant to keep bad energy at bay. She has also been seen wearing an Edge of Ember pendant, which has a gorgeous blue topaz stone and is said to protect its wearer from negative vibes. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.In addition, sheaposs also donned an Alemdara Hamsa necklace, which features the hand of Hamsa that is said to ward off negativity.Meghanaposs appearance at the New York Times event was her first in-person interview since she and Prince Harryaposs tell-all on the Oprah Winfrey show in March. Speaking to host Andrew Ross Sorkin, she said stepping back from royal duties had led to an improvement in her mental health.Mr Sorkin said there was a moment when a lot of the world was concerned and wondering about the comments she made in the Oprah interview. But the Duchess replied: Iaposm feeling much better about everything, thank you.  She also called for a aposdislikeapos button to be introduced on Instagram, highlighting the fact that Instagram has a like button and the ability to comment, but not a aposdislikeapos option. The online chat came a day before she joined husband Prince Harry at the Salute to Freedom Gala at the Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum in New York - hours after new evidence was heard in her privacy court case in London.Comment MORE ON Meghan MarkleRoyal FamilyJewellery" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news meghan-markles-dad-says-harry-"Thomas Markle says he is disappointed with Prince HarryByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov | comments Thomas Markle says Prince Harry should have asked him for permission to marry his daughter Meghan and he was disappointed it didnapost happen.Meghan and her father have had a fraught relationship in recent years with Thomas cut out of her le and reportedly never meeting the Sussexes’ children Achie and Lilibet. Thomas has been critical about Meghan and Harry and once again fired an attack at them in an interview where he criticised the Duke of Sussex before the  royal wedding. He claims he invited Meghan and Harry to his home in Mexico several times but they never took him up on his offer.  Thomas told GB News: “I’m very disappointed that Harry, wanting to marry my daughter, wouldn’t have had the good sense to come down here and ask for her hand. Someone who is royalty I would think would want to go by the book and do things properly but apparently it didn’t matter to him so that was a disappointment as well.” Thomas said he wanted to play a role in the lives of Meghan and Harry and his two grandchildren. “I certainly always want my family especially now the older I get the more I need my family, he said.  The father and daughter have reportedly not been on speaking terms since Thomas staged a photo shoot for press before his daughter got married to Harry in . He did not attend the wedding after having a heart attack and needing surgery. Mr Markle last appeared on British TV screens at the end of October when he was interviewed on Good Morning Britain. During the attack on the Sussexes, Thomas claimed he was being ghosted by Meghan and has vowed to continue to publicly attack his daughter until she begins speaking to him again. I think Harry has abandoned the Queen, the royal family, the British people and the Army. Heaposs abandoned them all, he said on GMB. news uk-news meghan-markles-jewellery-princess-diana-"Prince Harry and Meghan drive off to their wedding receptionByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Nov | commentsMeghan Markle stunned as she arrived at a military awards event with Prince Harry in a striking red evening gown. And although it was the Carolina Herrera dress that proved to be the showstopper, she also wore a beautul £, bracelet that once belonged to her late mother-in-law Princess Diana. The diamond tennis bracelet by Cartier has been sported by Meghan on numerous occasions, including during her tell-all interview with Oprah Winfrey in March. But itaposs not the only time that she worn pieces once owned by her husbandaposs mum - here we look at some of the beautul jewellery Meghan has worn in tribute to Diana... Diamond bracelet Princess Diana wore her Cartier diamond tennis bracelet several times before her tragic death in . And since Meghan married Harry, she has sported the bracelet, thought to be worth £, numerous times. The first was during a state dinner in Fiji in  and to observe Commonwealth Day in . Meghan also chose to wear the piece during her bombshell interview with Oprah Winfrey and it got its latest outing this week at the Intrepid Valor Awards in New York City. Cartier watch Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.Princess Diana regularly wore a gold Cartier Tank Française watch for engagements in the s.The watch gted to her by her father on her st birthday, was believed to have been given to Meghan by her now-husband Harry in the early days of their relationship. Meghan recently wore the watch in a YouTube video while reading her childrenaposs book The Bench and in a beautul picture taken of her and Harry for Time magazine in .However, it seems that the watch didnapost always belong to Harry.When Diana died, her private jewellery was ided up between her sons, and itaposs thought Prince William was given the watch, while Harry got her engagement ring - before they eventually swapped. In Amazon Prime show The Diana Story, the princessaposs former butler Paul Burrell explained that shortly before William proposed to his now-we the Duchess of Cambridge in , Harry offered his brother the chance to give his bride-to-be their motheraposs ring. Aquamarine ringOne of the first times Meghan wore jewellery once owned by the late Diana was on her wedding day. She sported an Emerald cut aquamarine ring, surrounded by small solitaire diamonds and set in -carat yellow gold, on her right hand at her evening reception.Diana had been previously pictured wearing the item, which was created by Asprey in , the same year she died following a Paris car crash. Butterfly earrings and gold bangle Shortly after their wedding, Meghan and Harry headed on a royal tour of Australia - and it coincided with the news they were expecting their first child Archie.And one their first engagements of the tour, Meghan wore a pair of stunning butterfly earrings and a gold bracelet that once belonged to Diana.The pieces were thought to be a gt from Harry to mark their happy baby news. At the time, Meghan gave onlookers a glimpse of the beautul jewel-encrusted butterfly earrings as she pushed her hair behind her ears, while the stunning bracelet, which features two blue stones, was on clear view. She has since worn the two pieces together since that day - at the launch of her clothing collection for charity SmartWorks. Engagement ring  Princess Dianaaposs engagement ring is now famously worn by Meghanaposs sister-in-law Kate.But Meghanaposs engagement ring still pays a beautul tribute to Diana in a dferent way.Thataposs because it features two diamonds from Dianaaposs collection and another from Botswana, where Harry does a lot of charity work. Harry designed Meghanaposs ring himself and spoke proudly about the piece during their engagement interview. He said: The ring is obviously yellow gold because thataposs her favourite and the main stone itself I sourced from Botswana, and the little diamonds either side are from my motheraposs jewellery collection, to make sure that sheaposs with us on this crazy journey together. title: mischievous dog swallows owners thong
story: Mischievous dog swallows his owners thong after ing into washing basketPanicked couple Helen Morgan and her partner rushed the dog to an emergency vets and were hit with a £ bill while the sheepish pooch sulked in the back of their carOwner Helen Morgan with partner David Ferry and cockapoo Charlie Bear Image: Kennedy News and MediaBySophie NorrisGraeme Murray:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments A mischievous dog has swallowed his owneraposs thong after ing into her washing basket.Helen Morgan had already been forced to keep the familyaposs socks at a height after her beloved cockapoo Charlie Bear chomped on them and was rushed to the vets when younger. But she never imagined the mischievous three-year-old pooch would have craving for her underwear too - ing into the washing basket and grabbing out her cotton thong. Full-time carer Helen,  and partner David Ferry, , were then forced to chase energetic dog around the living room but stood defeated as he swallowed the pants whole. The panicked pair then rushed him to the emergency vets and were hit with a £ bill - while the sheepish pooch quietly sulked in the back of their car. Hilarious pictures show Charlie Bear wearing his bandana with the slogan aposknicker snatcherapos alongside a sign saying aposI ate mamaposs knickers and it cost her £ to get them backapos. Helen, from Sunderland, Tyne and Wear, said: Charlieaposs really cheeky. He pinched my knickers out the laundry basket at night. It was a black cotton thong. He had them in his mouth and we chased him, which we shouldnapost have really. My partner had hold of them in his mouth but he wouldnapost give them up and he swallowed them whole. My partner couldnapost get them out. When he had it in his mouth, I knew it was another trip to the vets. Weaposve been before because he swallowed trainer socks. I called the emergency vets straight away. I said aposmy dog swallowed my knickersapos. It cost £. It was £ before we even left the house because it was after hours. Heaposs got expensive taste. Helen was forced to rush Charlie Bear for emergency treatment, which involved him being injected to induce vomiting. In a humiliating exchange, she was forced to discuss her underwear with staff at the vets - admitting she was thankful they werenapost aposbig belly warmersapos. Helen said: He struggled to swallow them but made sure he got them down, then he was fine. He wasnapost struggling to breathe or anything. We got to the vet and we had to ring them to say we were outside in the car park. The vet came out and we handed him over. They asked what time he swallowed them, what kind of knickers they were to make sure they werenapost big belly warmers. I was telling a total stranger about my knickers. I handed him over then they gave him an injection to make him sick. If you get there quick enough, they induce vomiting and the thong came straight up. The nurse then came out to say heaposd brought them up and my partner asked for them back. He was only joking and I said aposno, chuck them in the binapos. Charlie was a bit sheepish on the way home and a bit lethargic - quite quiet. We now have to keep the knickers in the wash basket upstairs and not the one downstairs. We already keep shoes and socks up high away from him because heaposs murder for them. If itaposs on the floor, itaposs his. As the crafty pup now enjoys quite the following online, he regularly models dog bandanas and has a custom-made slogan neckerchief with the phrase aposknicker snatcherapos on it. Helen said: Itaposs funny now. We were laughing the next day about it but at the time it was a bit of a shock. He wears bandanas every day and models for a lady that makes dog bandanas. Heaposs been named and shamed with the neckerchief. He wears the banana out and about now. A few people have asked about the slogan. They all laugh.
